Nightlife Special Report: Ambulances called 380 times to clubs since 2011

Between 2011 and March 2013, ambulances have been called out 380 times to all of York's main nightclubs in the city centre, with Club Salvation topping the number of call-outs consistently for all 3 years.

Nightlife Special Report: How Safe is York's Nightlife?

By James Bithell

YUSU propose to take over Cafe Barista

YUSU have announced plans to put together a business case to take over the running of Cafe Barista.

YUSU's first aid training plea

The Student Union have submitted a request to the University to increase the role of 'Lights On' Facilities Reception Assistants.

Council to investigate Hull Road Off-licence

ELO Off-licence on Hull Road is being investigated by City of York Council's Trading Standards Department for the second time in as many years.

Academics attack whisky industry

York and London researchers have discovered that the alcohol industry 'distorted' international evidence on effective alcohol control measures submitted to the Scottish Government to change Scotland's relationship with alcohol.

Langwith push for reform

Langwith JCRC have spoken out against the University, arguing further changes are needed to their heating system.

Fenech-Soler to perform at Big D

Electropop band Fenech-Soler have been announced as the second Big D headliner.

Water shortage at Goodricke

Students in Goodricke College have suffered numerous failures of their water supply over many months.

Student charity set up to bridge education gap

By James Bithell

A charity part founded by University students is using Philosophy to empower bright children from disadvantaged backgrounds.

Student set for South Pole

A York student is undertaking a 462 mile mission to the South Pole.

Ambulances called 380 times to clubs since 2011

Club Salvation has consistently had the most ambulance call-outs.

Legal dispute led to broken fire regulations in Tokyo

Tokyo's dispute with its electric supplier led to an unsuitable generator being used.

Campaigners clash over Sun referendum debate

Last night's referendum debate saw the coordinators of both the Yes and No campaigns for all four motions argue their case and respond to questions from the floor.

New measures proposed to prevent exam problems for disabled students

YUSU, alongside the University, will be implementing new measures to help tackle problems with exams for disabled students.

York ranked 12th in Complete University Guide

The University of York has been ranked as the 12th best institution in the UK in the Complete University Guide for 2014

York in bottom five for contact hours of History and Physics

It has emerged that York is one of the worst universities in the UK in terms of contact hours for some subjects, with history students receiving the least contact hours of any institution in the UK

Langwith students to receive PS30k in compensation

The University has agreed to pay Langwith College PS30,000 for students in compensation as a result of a campaign pioneered by Langwith JCRC and YUSU after an unprecedented level of complaints

York 37th for student experience despite improvement

York has been ranked as 37th in the UK for student experience in a survey by Times Higher Education

Cantor appointed Bradford Vice-Chancellor

Outgoing University Vice-Chancellor Brian Cantor will be leaving earlier than expected to take up the role of Vice-Chancellor at the University of Bradford

Demo2012 had 'no measurable impact' according to NUS

The NUS have released their official evaluation of demo2012 following feedback from over 1000 students, Student Union Staff and members of the public, with the overall result being that it had no measurable positive impact.

YUSU petitions against closure of Barista Cafe

The University has defended its decision to close Cafe Barista in response to the launch of YUSU's petition

York Tory members behind Pro-Thatcher anthem's rise in UK singles charts

Two members of the University of York Conservatives are behind 'I'm In Love With Margaret Thatcher' gaining a position in the top ten of the UK singles chart.

Taylor's maintenance loan motion passed by NUS Conference

The motion put forward to the NUS by YUSU President Kallum Taylor to have a fourth maintenance loan for medical, midwifery, and nursing students was passed by the NUS conference

Toni Pearce elected NUS President

Toni Pearce has been elected President of the National Union of Students (NUS) following a vote at the conference in Sheffield and will take over from Liam Burns

New road links for Hes East proposed by York Council

Proposals have been announced by City of York Council for improving cycle and pedestrian links between Heslington West and Heslington East campuses, with the main focus on University Road and Field Lane.

New bus service for Fishergate and Fulford

A new number 27 bus service will be introduced serving those in Fishergate and Fulford

YUSU prepare for cost of implementing Living Wage

YUSU have decided to explore the true cost of the Living Wage proposal in anticipation of the referendum on the issue, but there are concerns on how the proposal could be funded.

Proportion of state school admissions lowest since 2004

The percentage of state-educated undergraduates admitted to the University is at its lowest since 2004, but still higher than other Russell Group institutions.

Q&A: the new VC on salaries, carbon emissions, and semesterisation

We put the big questions to Professor Koen, the incoming Vice Chancellor
